t: Proverbs 31
The*p words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
What,*p my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?
Give*p not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
It*p is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
Lest*p they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
Give*p strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
Let*p him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
Open*p thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
Open*p thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
Who*p can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
The*p heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
She*p will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
She*p seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
She*p is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
She*p riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.
She*p considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
She*p girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
She*p perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.
She*p layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
She*p stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
She*p is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
She*p maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
Her*p husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
She*p maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
Strength*p and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
She*p openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
She*p looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
Her*p children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
Many*p daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.
Favour*p is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the Lord,*s she shall be praised.
Give*p her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
